text: Saint-Gilles is a commune. It is in Occitanie in the Gard department in south France. The abbey of Saint-Gilles was founded during the 7th century traditionally by the hermit Saint Giles (Latin: Ã†gidius). It was the birthplace of Guy Foulques, Pope Clement IV (died 1268), whose birth house is now a museum of the archaeology, ethnology and ornithology of the Camargue. == Twin towns == Saint-Gilles is twinned with: * Altopascio, Italy * Abensberg, Germany == References == Category:Communes in Gard
title: Saint-Gilles, Gard
